intro: Psychotria trispicata, commonly known as the three-spined psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically eaten by birds. Psychotria trispicata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and undergrowth.
